title: BaseFeePendingTransactionsSorter encountering empty `maxPriorityFeePerGas`
body:
Saw this stack trace six times today -

It makes little sense because to get into the `prioritizedTransactionsStaticRange` set (lines 206 & 287) you have to be filtered via isInStaticRange, which requires said optional to no be null.

The safest fix is probably to `orElse` it to a value that will cause the promptest eviction (since something went wrong, like a mutable transaction, which I don't see in current code). 0 or 2^256-1?

This is actually a fairly benign error, but the stack trace is not a good look.  The worst of it is that we fail the 60 second periodic evictOldTransactions timer.

What is happening is `evictOldTransactions` is attempting to drop a transaction that has been kicked out concurrently.

1. evictOldTransactions identifies a non-EIP1559 transaction T1 to evict
2. T1 gets concurrently evicted by addTransactionToPool (or a newly imported block, or whatever)
3. BaseFeePendingTransactionSorter [tries to evict from the dynamic pool but does not find it](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/ethereum/eth/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/eth/transactions/sorter/BaseFeePendingTransactionsSorter.java#L106-L107)
4. evictOldTransactions tries to evict T1 from the static range instead, and the comparator blows up because it isn't a 1559 txn

I am not certain why this seems to be happening more frequently than it did with 22.7.1(-) , but it is likely because we are evicting transactions from the senderAndNonce collection and that opens the concurrency window up a bit wider for this to happen more frequently.  

An `.orElse(Wei.ZERO)` can fix this, or we can check to see if the transaction is in the static range on 107 before we try to evict it from the static pool.
